intro: Lithocardium hebecarpum, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock-cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lithocardium hebecarpum is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor environments.
